title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1631-2.3 - Tenant safety
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1631-2.3 - Tenant safety

State Regulations
(a) The
fostering of an accident conscious climate can aid greatly in the campaign for
safety. Proper tenant attitudes tend to minimize the incidence of accidents. Aids which will assist the authority in this aspect of the safety program are
periodic announcements and narratives in the project newspaper; the placing of
notices and posters in public areas; announcements at tenant meetings and the
inclusion of notices and announcements with rent receipts. (b) The issue of authority owned equipment, such as hand lawn mowers, garden tools, etc., for use in tenant maintenance
imposes a possible liability on the authority in the event of personal injury
resulting from such use. Consequently, such equipment should be loaned only to
members of tenants' households who are physically and mentally capable of using
such equipment. (c) Power mowers, electric tools and other equipment considered hazardous will not be issued for
tenants' use. Notes
